phrases: Not a day goes by in Paris without someone
mentioning the name of Mr. Shinomiya Kojiro, the chef of SHINO'S,
and now he is opening his first restaurant in Japan in Tokyo.
Gourmands have mounting expectations for Mr. Shinomiya's dishes,
as he is called the Magician of Legumes...
I barely get any sleep getting ready for the opening.
That is exactly why Chef Dojima suggested sending over a student
to serve as your opening staff.
Shinomiya Kojiro Chef, French Restaurant SHINO'S
I am sure you would be happy to cooperate,
given that the request is coming from me,
a sad hired chef at Totsuki.
Like I said before, do not hold that against me!
What would you know about any of this?!
You are a hired chef for the Totsuki Group!
I will not accept anyone less than one of the Autumn Election finalists.
I was not expecting you, of all people, Yukihira.
I did not think I would end up in your restaurant.
I will be in Shinomiya Kojiro's kitchen...
Not to mention, I need to make a visible mark if I am going to pass the Stagiaire.
It will not be easy, but I will do it.
First, you will be wrapping up construction and interior work.
That is the stage they are still at?
Do you want to get fired?!
Gao Wei Service Manager, SHINO'S Flagship Restaurant
We have to create the menu at the same time, too.
Lucie Hugo Chief Blucher, SHINO'S Flagship Restaurant
Considering our remaining budget, we will do what we can on our own.
I was very selective about things like the interior and the dishware.
But Chef Shinomiya, you could get any budget you want.
All the sponsors who backed my flagship restaurant
You are thinking about opening a new restaurant at a time like this?
have opposed my opening this restaurant.
I cannot ask them for money.
We are staff from SHINO'S, the flagship restaurant.
We are here to support the Tokyo restaurant until things settle down after it opens!
He is the head chef of SHINO'S Tokyo, Abel Blondin.
Abel Blondin Head Chef, SHINO'S Tokyo (Ex Sous Chef, SHINO'S)
He was the sous chef in the main restaurant,
so he is Chef Shinomiya's right-hand man.
Well, I am lucky I get to train at your restaurant, Senpai.
Shut up and just carry the cabinet!
He is acting so familiar with Chef Shinomiya!
He has no idea how long it took me to get friendly with Chef Shinomiya!
And when he finally picked me to be the head chef of the Tokyo restaurant,
it was the best moment of my life!
It is only the millionth time you are telling us this.
But Chef Shinomiya's gotten pretty mellow, has not he?
Did the change happen after he went to Japan in spring?
He was some kind of judge, right?
I think he became a bit nicer when he got back.
He will teach you with patience if you ask him about cooking, too.
He might complain while doing it, but still!
Maybe he actually likes teaching and looking after people.
Focus on the work at hand.
what made you decide to open a new restaurant?
I read in Totsuki Sports that it is rare to open a new restaurant
when you are trying to get three Michelin stars.
And what did you mean earlier?
About being lucky that you can train at my restaurant?
It would have been easier to pass the Stagiaire
if you would been assigned to a small local restaurant.
I need to come up with a specialty.
I cannot stay the way I am now.
I have to take one step forward
and shine a new light on my cooking.
We can finally see the light at the end of the tunnel, though.
What should we do for lunch?
Chef Shinomiya will cook for us?
We will get to eat Chef Shinomiya's staff lunch!
Carefully sauteeing mushrooms, hen-of-the-woods, and shimeji with butter...
Then pour in an appareil made from eggs, soy milk, and white miso
into a mold lined with pie crust dough.
It is originally a regional dish from Lorraine,
and a typical lunch menu item, even in Paris.
Not that you would know, since you are not familiar with France.
It is perfect for a staff lunch, too.
It is no wonder you do not know.
The ingredient tends to be avoided in the West.
The crunchy texture of thinly-shaved burdock root
It pairs well with the juicy chicken and the black pepper, too!
How did he achieve such deep flavors without even using bouillon?
He extracted the sweetness and bitterness from the skin of the burdock root
in perfect balance, to provide an edge to the mellow flavors of the chicken and cheese.
Combining Japanese ingredients in this way into a regional French dish!
This dish is good enough to serve at the main SHINO'S restaurant!
No wonder you are the Magician of Legumes!
Damn, I have still got a long way to go.
All right, let us open up some wine!
Are not we barely within budget?
It will go to waste if we do not pair it with wine.
he still thinks it is not good enough?
You will get closer to your own specialty over the course of this week.
That is, if you can keep up with the work I require until the end.
The Next Day: Day 1 of the Pre-Open
It suits you better than I thought it would.
What do you mean, better than you thought?
And here I thought I would get a laugh out of you.
It is almost time for the pre-open.
By the way, what is the difference between the pre-open and the actual open?
Basically, it is a practice run before the official open.
You invite mostly people you know,
and check how well the staff are working together while serving guests food.
Also, it is partly to test the new menu of SHINO'S Tokyo.
We will be changing dishes every day while checking how the guests respond.
On the final day of the pre-open,
we will even do a competition between the staff members for new menu items.
You are done with your assigned tasks?
Oh, I have also already marinated octopus and daikon root for half a day.
Yukihira, you will be my assistant for now.
Once you get used to the work,
you might also become Abel-san's assistant.
Okay, I will try my best!
In the pre-open, three courses will be available for order.
Depending on the course, a different main dish is served,
Well, either way, it is easy when you know every dish that needs to be prepared.
Shinomiya-san, it is been too long!
What is with this sudden tension?
Please watch over me, O Lord.
I can only hear the sound of knives,
and the simmering of the soup.
Do not make any unnecessary noise.
Next time that happens, I will be kicking you out.
It is so you do not miss any minute change in sound.
It is different from any other kitchen I have experienced!
It is just as good as its reputation!
Quietly strain that fumet de poisson.
Even single prep work task has double the number of steps there would be for a diner dish.
In addition, even while we are making appetizers,
we also have to start preparing the time-consuming main dishes at the same time.
Also, prepare a mirepoix ready to go by around the time Table 3 finishes eating.
But I can manage to keep up, just barely.
so I need to start with prepping the fish for Table 1.
Sorry, it is not ready yet!
it is an ironclad rule to serve the next dish only after everyone at the table
You have to match the pace of the guests
and adjust when you will serve the next dish!
and they all arrived at different times.
If you rush to prep for one table,
a different table will sneak up on you!
Yukihira, start prepping the mirepoix right away.
Wei, Table 3's meat dish will be delayed five minutes.
Abel, clean up after Yukihira's mistake.
Until now, if I have fallen behind,
I have just had to worry about catching up on my own.
But here, if I fall behind,
I will affect everyone involved in preparing the course menu!
I have not accepted you as one of the team.
We do not need anyone who will slow down the kitchen's workflow.
I am the head chef of SHINO'S Tokyo.
I have a responsibility to manage the work.
In the end, you are just part of the Stagiaire.
Do not get arrogant and think you have made your way into the team.
Now that you get it, know your place
Sorry, I will be right back!
I am going to become a core member by the last day!
You can use the staff shower anytime you want.
The kitchen staff usually arrive around noon,
so take care of personal matters until then.
Do not oversleep, no matter what.
Based on how you worked today,
it would be better if you did not stay, really.
My success in Japan depends on the pre-open.
You may not feel the pressure, being a student and all.
I plan to bring in more customers starting tomorrow.
The workload will increase two or three-fold.
Unless you change, you will not be here by the last day.
You are not going to give him any advice?
I do not have the time to hold his hand.
Quietly strain that fumet de poisson.
This recette requires the ingredients to be julienned!
If you do it again, I will kick you out.
Hayama Akira Yukihira Soma Kurokiba Ryo
The thickness and the length of each type differ.
As for how to cut fish,
there is medaillon, darne, tronCon, and escalope.
I have to differentiate between them based on the ingredients and the dish.
Um, so I had questions about how to cut ingredients, the ones I messed up yesterday.
May I ask you for your time?
We have to clean and prep ingredients.
You have got some nerve asking after holding us back yesterday, huh?
The restaurant cannot waste any more on you
The cleaning and peeling... everything's done.
What do you want to know, Yukihira?
Oh, about the different cutting techniques...
I get that medaillon and darne basically look like this,
He did all this work by himself?
but do tronCon and escalope basically look like this and that?
Did he even get any sleep?
Oh, well tronCon is like this.
Sorry, I will get right to it after I am done with this!
Is not that kind of like an hors d'oeuvre?
Okay, I will make it an entree.
This is three days in a row.
Yeah, I am really sorry to bother you like this.
So, today I have about fifty questions!
Oh, you did it just like I taught you.
There are about three things I want to improve.
How can he stay so indifferent
So my way is fine, then.
after being berated day after day?
You can figure out the rest on your own.
He should be painfully aware of how useless he is.
Yes, tomorrow is the last day of our pre-open event.
I do not have even a second to feel sorry for myself.
Because I am having way too much fun mastering new techniques!
Table 4's quickly working through their course!
Can we hurry up their soup?
I am not done with the prep work.
You have memorized the recette, have not you?
Well, that was the best food I have ever tasted!
I am glad I could check it out during the pre-open.
I would like to bring a few friends next time.
Once it opens, we will not be able to make a reservation.
Do not slack on the last day, Yukihira.
Abel, do you object to keeping Yukihira around?
Well, I suppose he gets passing marks right now.
I was really worried for a while.
You did not give him any advice.
There is no point if he cannot figure it out on his own.
Shinomiya-senpai, I am sorry to bother you,
but I have one more thing.
Does that Totsuki rule apply to alumni, too?
If I beat you in a Shokugeki,
You challenged me, of all people.
You would not fail at something like the Stagiaire.
Sorry, do you have a minute?
Since it looks like I am allowed to stay until the last day, I have a request.
There will be a new menu item competition after the restaurant closes tomorrow, right?
I want to submit a dish, too.
But you have had your hands full assisting us!
No, I always planned on participating in the competition.
I want to make everything I have envisioned until now into a reality as soon as I can.
Come to think of it, it will be the first time I will have tasted an original recette of yours.
But I will not guarantee that your hard-won confidence will survive this.
I swear I will make him speechless...
